labels.analysis: The MCP Server focuses on providing real-time cryptocurrency price data and market analysis, leveraging the CoinCap API (V3) to deliver comprehensive insights into market trends and dynamics. Its core functionality revolves around fetching, analyzing, and presenting cryptocurrency market data, which is a key requirement for crypto traders, investors, and analysts. The optional sign-in feature suggests some level of user management or personalization, but the primary use case is clearly market data analysis. The reliance on an external API (with authentication) indicates that this is fundamentally an API-driven data service.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" captures the server's primary functionality of crypto market analysis. The secondary label "API Integration" acknowledges the heavy reliance on the CoinCap API (V3) for data retrieval. The server could also be considered under "Data Analysis & Processing" due to its analytical capabilities, but this is less central than its crypto-specific focus. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover its functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: Crypto Price & Market Analysis Server
server_info_crawled.author: @wazzan/mcp-coincap-jj
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide real-time cryptocurrency price data and market analysis through an easy-to-use interface. Analyze historical trends and get detailed insights into market dynamics. Leverage the CoinCap API for comprehensive cryptocurrency analysis. Uses new V3 API (You have to use an API key)

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@wazzan/mcp-coincap-jj/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
